main event: A strong glow was observed in the direction of the Clipper Mountains near Danby, California, in late September 1958, with witnesses believing it was a UFO, which they later concluded was a reflection from radio antennas.
interesting points: The glow was observed for approximately 20 minutes at the same time for two consecutive days.,Witnesses described the objects as appearing aluminum and fuselage-shaped, estimated to be 15 feet long and 5 feet high.,The objects were first thought to be a crashed aircraft before the witnesses deduced the reflection from antennas.,Three men initially observed the glow and later investigated the area but found no trace of the objects.,The Air Force investigation confirmed the objects were likely caused by sunlight reflecting off radio antennas visible only during specific conditions.
